Suggested_Setup: A faction demands a tax/fee to pass. It might be a scam or legitimate.
Someone asks for food/medicine. Helping them grants intel; ignoring them has consequences.
A trader has a broken wagon/ship. Helping them unlocks a unique shop inventory.
An NPC mistakes the party for someone else (heroes or criminals).
An NPC knows a secret but requires a favor or specific item in exchange.
Authorities demand papers/inspection. Players must bluff, bribe, or show credentials.
A competing party is resting nearby. They boast, spy, or offer a friendly wager.
A zealot demands the party perform a small ritual or accept a blessing/curse.
Someone in chains asks for help getting free. Are they innocent or dangerous?
An NPC is intoxicated and causing a scene, blocking progress or seeking a brawl.
An NPC watches the party from a distance but flees if approached (scout/spy).
Two NPCs are arguing (over loot/land). They ask the party to judge who is right.
An NPC challenges the party to a game of chance for high stakes.
An attractive/charming NPC tries to get close to a party member to steal something.
An NPC dies at the party's feet, handing them a macguffin or cryptic note.
An NPC is tending to a dangerous beast and asks the party not to startle it.
An NPC refuses to speak to a specific species/class in the party.
An NPC from a character's backstory appears in an unexpected role.
An NPC claims to work for the villain but offers to defect for a price.
A local celebration is blocking the street; players must participate to pass.
